intro: Urostigma pseudotsiela, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has a low-growing habit and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
